newsitem.title: CYPRUS: Cyprus Airways pilots threaten strike.
newsitem.headline: Cyprus Airways pilots threaten strike.

text.p: Cyprus Airways pilots have threatened to strike unless a pilot suspended from duty is back at work by the weekend.

Pilots union Pasipi on Tuesday authorised its board to "take necessary measures, including a strike" to rectify what they called the witch-hunt of their colleague by the company, a union statement said.
The pilot was relieved of his duties after a flight incident in early July.
Pasipi, which says his suspension is unjustified, is calling for his immediate reinstatement and asks that the company foot the bill to re-train the pilot because of his prolonged absence from work.
A company announcement called the pilots to a dialogue to resolve the issue.
It said the company was exerting efforts for the pilot to return to his normal duties after the completion of a training programme.
The dispute prompted a 48-hour strike threat from Pasipi at the peak of the holiday season in August.
It was suspended at the last minute after appeals from the government, which controls 80 percent of the airline.
